Crimes.Crime_Name: Subject to a removal order under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Eligibility for citizenship while under a removal order
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant was issued a removal order due to non-compliance with residency obligations; appeal ongoing but does not stay removal order
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Failed to meet residency obligations leading to removal order
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Removal order issued under IRPA due to residency non-compliance
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Interpretation of s. 5(1)(f) of Citizenship Act
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Status under removal order regardless of appeal status
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Appeal process does not suspend removal order
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied by Federal Court
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Residency records, immigration file, appeal documentation
Crimes.Application_Basis: Individual must not be under a removal order to qualify for citizenship
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Documentation of removal order and appeal status
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Under s. 5(1)(f), being under a removal order confers ineligibility for citizenship
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Loss of citizenship eligibility pending resolution of removal order
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant failed to meet residency obligations, leading to a removal order
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Removal order was in force during application; eligibility barred under law

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with residency obligation
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Loss of permanent resident status and impact on citizenship eligibility
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant issued departure order for failing residency requirement; appeal ongoing
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Ineligible for citizenship due to removal order status
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Permanent resident (status retained until final appeal decision)
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Did not fulfill minimum physical presence requirement in Canada
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Departure order issued under IRPA for residency non-compliance
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Interpretation of IRPA s. 46(1)(c) and Citizenship Act s. 5(1)(c) & (f)
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Timing of loss of permanent resident status relative to removal order enforcement
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Appeal of removal order does not preserve eligibility for citizenship
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Travel records, residency logs, immigration status documents
Crimes.Application_Basis: Must be a permanent resident and not under removal order to apply for citizenship
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Proof of absence from Canada exceeding permitted limits
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Overturn citizenship judge's finding of ineligibility
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Permanent resident status lost when removal order comes into force after appeals exhausted
Crimes.Outcome: Appeal dismissed; applicant ineligible until removal order resolved
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Delayed or denied citizenship due to unresolved immigration status
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant's failure to meet residency requirements led to a departure order
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Residency history verified through official immigration databases
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Despite ongoing appeal, applicant remained under removal order and thus ineligible
